modules.description: Handles UDPv4 communication by providing functions to listen on and write to specific ports, with support for demultiplexing incoming packets. Operates on IP addresses, ports, and Cstruct buffers, and returns results or errors for network operations. Used to manage network connections, process incoming data, and send packets with customizable source and destination parameters.

Provides functions to manage TCPv4 connections, including reading from and writing to flows, closing connections, and handling errors. Operates on flow handles, IP addresses, and custom error types, supporting both buffered and nodelay write modes. Enables establishing and listening for TCP connections, with options for keepalive settings and error reporting.

Provides pretty-printers for IP addresses and errors, and manages IP layer communication. Handles demultiplexing incoming packets to TCP, UDP, or custom protocols, and constructs IP packets with options for fragmentation and TTL. Works with IPv4 addresses, interfaces, and callbacks for packet processing, supporting tasks like sending and receiving network traffic.

handles network communication through UDPv4, TCPv4, and IP layer operations, enabling packet reception, transmission, and protocol demultiplexing. It works with IP addresses, ports, Cstruct buffers, and flow handles, supporting operations like listening, sending, reading, writing, and error handling. Examples include processing incoming UDP packets, establishing TCP connections, and constructing IP packets with custom options. It facilitates low-level network interaction with fine-grained control over data flow and protocol handling.

Tracks and aggregates numerical data points from labeled sources, supporting real-time enablement or disablement of metrics collection. Operates on tagged sources and numeric values, with support for counters, gauges, and timers. Used to monitor system performance and resource usage in production environments with minimal overhead.

handles network communication through UDPv4, TCPv4, and IP layers, managing packet reception, transmission, and protocol demultiplexing using IP addresses, ports, Cstruct buffers, and flow handles. It supports operations such as listening, sending, reading, writing, and error handling, enabling low-level control over data flow and protocol implementation. Examples include processing UDP packets, establishing TCP connections, and constructing IP packets with custom options. Key data types include IP addresses, ports, Cstructs, and flow handles, with operations focused on network interaction and protocol management.
